description:
All Star Cafe is my guilty pleasure. When I'm craving a fresh, glazed donut or a perfect grilled cheese sandwich I come here. Prices are 50% of any other lunch place nearby. Yes it's a little chaotic sometimes but that's part of it's charm. 

I'd recommend the grilled cheese sandwich, the fried egg sandwich, any of the donuts. Sandwiches come with a free packet of chips!
author: Rachel B.

description:
All Star Cafe is located at the corner of South Van Ness & Market. There is plenty of meter street parking and paid private lots towards the rear of the Cafe.

Their donut selection consisted of all the regular donuts seen at many other typical shops. 

I tried the Old Fashion Maple Donut. The donut had more of a soft interior and left an oily layer in my mouth. The donut seemed average and nothing stood out to separate it from other donuts I tried. The price of the donut is a little steep. I don't mind paying more for a good product. In this case the quality of donut and price did not match. 

Considering the price and average donut is why I gave it a low Rating. Next time I'll probably stick to my regular go-to shop but their location and hours are convenient from my work.
author: Paul V.

description:
I live nearby so this is my go to donut and quick breakfast place. It's cheap, fast and greasy, so it has all of the qualities I expect in the morning.

It sometimes gets chaotic when it comes to picking up your order. Maybe they should use numbers or names rather than just calling what you have ordered.
author: Jakub S.

description: Do NOT go for the pastries here. They don't chuck away stuff and just leave it overnight... In an unrefrigerated location.
author: David K.

description:
Thai noodle salad with and without chicken are the best things about this donut/sandwich shop. I have been going here for years just for the Thai noodle salads....as for the donuts and pastries,  always fresh and quite a selection of favorites (my favorites are the French donuts)
..Also a great place to grab a bite if you work late at night..
author: Sakkara C.

description:
All star cafe's large, lit windows are brightest late at night when you've missed the last bArt train and need something sweet to prepare you for the trans bay bus wait. The space is a no-frills old school donut shop and looks its best when what you're after is a quick fix. Add this spot into your morning commute if a greasy cheap breakfast suits you, it's a place to grab lunch, or a coffee and pastry to snack on. If you do decide to linger the large windows make for excellent people-watching.

The sandwiches are really hit or miss but you cannot go wrong with those vermicelli / pasta Thai salads in the fridge!!
author: J W.

description:
Dirty divey sketcheriffic purveyors of donuts. Thankfully they are below-average donuts, tasting a bit like the fryer oil may be aging and/or shared with other menu items - curbing chances of addiction. 

The owners and staff are friendly, patient, and efficient. Thank you! Unfortunately, customer service and long hours are the sole strengths for the operation. 

Eclectic clientele - ranging from local office & city workers through the depths of misery and open addiction that are common and tragic in the Civic Center neighborhood. 

Really impressed how fellow helpers produced kinda flattering pics of this place. I don't think they're representative, other than food close ups.
author: Barry H.

description: Third time in a row that I've ordered a sandwich only to discover that it was made incorrectly even though I paid extra.  Horrible service.
author: Chris G.

description: Great place for breakfast, coffee selection is good and also donuts looks all delicious
author: Ahmed M.

description:
Been coming here for years with nothing but great experiences but the experience I had tonight with one of your new staff members has completely turned me off from ever returning.

Please consider teaching your arrogant young male night shift employee some manners. The asshole refused to sell me my (under $10) worth of products without my ID (despite coming here regularly for YEARS and never once being asked for my ID) and when I told him it was stolen he refused to sell me my food. Immediately after telling me this he and the other employees continue to sell everybody else in line their purchases via debit card without asking a single one of them for it. When I asked again he very rudely refused and told me to leave. 

You have permanently lost me as a customer and I urge everybody else to stay away from their awful, childish staff.
author: John M.

description:
I was drunk.  I ordered a dutch crunch something with avocado.  it saved my life.

**edit**

Just confirmed it was a Chicken bacon avocado sandwich on sourdough.  OMG.
author: Chris L.

description: Came into All Star to get a Tuna Sandwich & Donut Holes. The Tuna Sandwich was stale and disgusting. The taste of the sandwich is just too bland. It only had tomatoes & pickles. The sandwich didn't even make me full.  It wasn't worth $7.50. The donut holes felt overnighted and tasted a bit weird. Sorry, if I had to rate this place it would be 2/5.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Big fan of their chicken and avocado sandwich. Given their location and hours I have a feeling they see a lot of unsavory stuff. You may see some as well. For the most part they have as good a handle on things as they can. And if you're coming here your focus should be on the food. Service is friendly but could be quicker (coming from a guy who's eaten at delis in NY/NJ his whole life). 

Food: 4/5
Space: 3/5
Service: 3/5
author: Derrick F.

description: Affordable prices. Good donuts. Good BLT. Nice owners and workers. Coffee not so good.
author: Leslie B.

description:
It's super convenient if you're just walking to work and you are craving a donut, but it's really nothing too special.

I ordered a chocolate glazed donut, service was quick but overall it didn't leave much of a lasting impression at all. 

It's a little bit run down and kind of sketchy, but I could definitely see myself going there out again purely out of convenience. Not a place to go for an experience.
author: Natasha G.

description: I have stopped by here after going to the Symphony many times to pick up a snack. I wanted a bagel and cream cheese last night. Everybody was touching the bagel with their bare hands..EEW! Put on some gloves and learn how to handle food correctly! The guy was handling the cream cheese with his bare hands..disgusting for real!
author: Denise C.

description:
This is a convenient place for lunch near my office.  I usually just order the Tuna Salad Sandwich, which is a big enough sandwich at $5.75 and it comes with a small bag of chips.
Donuts galore!  I've been able to withstand the temptation of getting them.  But I did give in one time for a Pecan bar, which was surprisingly good.
Quick service.  It's not the best spot to sit and enjoy, so just order and leave.
author: Karen L.

description:
I got stuck in town working overnight, went there at 3:00 am... i just wanted some coffee... i didn't dare. The place looks rough at night. 
I asked the Uber driver to keep driving away.
author: Cos T.

description:
The hamburgers are the best. The donuts  are pretty sweet too. (See what I did there!) I'll miss this place when I'm in New York.

Also, why can't I emoji the donut, yelp! Why?
author: Daniel P.

description:
People can hate on All Star all they want.  But if you lived on Market St, and this was your only close and affordable late night food option, you would love All Star too.  If this wasn't 24 hours, it would definitely only be a 3 star establishment.

Doughnuts:  You cannot go wrong with the doughnuts.  My personal favorite is the vanilla cake with chocolate icing and rainbow sprinkles.  Airy, fluffy, fresh, and only $1.  There are plenty of different kinds ranging from $1-$2.  Yes, there are sometimes flies in the cases, but these doughnuts are worth it.

BLT w/ Chips:  Shockingly good.  The BLT comes with plenty of thick bacon, with fresh L&T, and the bread is always the best part.  Fresh and chewy.  Just a standard bag of chips, but the price is reasonable.

Bagel with Cream Cheese:  DON'T GET IT.  This was the only terrible thing I ate here.  Just go to Safeway and buy a bagel with cream cheese.  This is what the Manhattan food vendors at 42nd St feed tourists.  It's a cheap soggy bagel with a slab of processed cream cheese product.  Disgusting.

Drinks:  There are a ton of different drinks to chose from, and they're priced close to the same as Walgreens across the street.

ATM:  They do have an ATM, but a friend said that the surcharge was terrible.

The homeless people do panhandle inside here or right at the door.  Some of the workers try to deter them, but just get your food and put that cash away.
author: Amanda J.

description: I used to go here all the time. The coffee is pretty good. I'm not a fan of strong, bitter coffee, so I like their coffee. It was also very convenient for me to stop at getting off the F-line on Market & Van Ness on my way to the office on Hayes Street. Their pastries and sandwiches are very 'meh', in my opinion. I could make the same quality at home myself. What I don't like is the service. I understand they are busy and things get a little hectic sometimes, especially right around the 8:00-9:00AM hour before people head to work. But on more than one occasion, a customer walked in, jumped to the front of the line, and got service immediately with no questions. On one occasion, I said something to the worker, because I didn't think it was fair for TWO people to be helped who weren't even in line, and he got REALLY snappy with me. I have stopped going there because of this, but if you're looking for a quick place with OK coffee for a cheap price, this is your place.
author: Charlie L.

description: Not only is this place a dump but their prices are ridiculous.  I stopped in to get a bacon and egg sandwich, coffee and orange juice.  When he said 14.00 dollars, I asked "how much is the sandwich?", he replied "9.50",  I said F___  that are you insane?  I am not usually that vulgar but there is no justification to charge that much for a sandwich that cost them less than 1.00 for ingredients.  I recently moved here from the NYC area and I have never ever had someone look me in the face and tell me that a breakfast sandwich is almost 10.00, from a dump.  Hell, when Carnegie Deli was still open, it was 6.25.  Some guy behind me was muttering about it being the only place that is open and it is San Francisco.  Yeah, whatever, I ain't spending 10.00 for a breakfast sandwich.  As far as I am concerned this is a ripoff and I will never set foot in that place again.  Crooks. Well, I will add this to SF's overpriced crappy pizza.  By the way, late night dining options sucks in this city.
author: Colin Y.

description: So usually when I come for my morning coffee in good every Sunday 3.50 no  priggish but today I was like why not try there food so I was going to order a danish n until my little chef eyes caught hold of the bugs crawling on it. I called her over to tell her so she can discard it but then she took it as if I wanted to buy the DAMN  thing and I tell her I don't want that so she grabs another one and I told her I don't want any of them. So SHE PUTS THE FLIPPING BUG INFESTED DANISHED BACK!!! I was so surprised and when she saw my face she said something to her employee and threw it away...... really.... If it wasn't for my hot latte that it's possible to kill anything at 215 degrees we would have much bigger issues then this...
author: Lady C.

description:
Crummy part of town with crummy price hikes for things that should be free (bagel with butter vs bagel with cream cheese $2 differential!!) 

But great sandwiches
author: Grey G.

description: Their chai latte was one of the best I've ever had. I also loved their donuts. I will definitely be back.
author: Grace Z.

description: #neveragain Not only was they're donuts more than day old looking and they are expensive for what they were. The young guy working the register had to argue and fight with an older disabled homeless man. He stated that the older man was bring out the Brooklyn in him. Puh! Twice he left the store to argue and get physical with the older and obviously not well homeless man. Never again will I purchase anything from that store. Our city doesn't need that kind of aggression over coffee and old pastried. I never need "Drama" with my snacks.
author: Thomas T.

description: Got a BLT and it was fine. Pretty overpriced and slow. Nice that it's open 24 hours a day.
author: Benjamin K.

description: Incredibly delicious philly cheese steak sandwhiches. Service is fast and the owner is quite friendly. Recommend
author: Danny M.

description:
Went here this morning to purchase 3 dozen of donuts for my coworkers in this 'Random Acts of Kindness Week'  

The lady preparing my order wiped her nose with her gloved hand that was handling my food.  I asked her in a shocking manner 'Did you just wipe your hand on your nose?  I then responded 'I Don't Think So!  And walked out!  How Disgusting!
author: Kimberly C.

description: Pretty crappy service. I ordered an everything bagel with avocado, which took about 10 minutes to come out--when several customers who had come in after me got their food before me. They messed up my order, too, and gave me a sesame bagel instead of the everything bagel I had ordered. Not a huge deal, but they didn't offer to fix it right away, instead just asked if I minded the different bagel, which I took because I had been waiting so long already. Wouldn't go here except for the convenience and lack of affordable & quick bagel/breakfast joints in the area.
author: Lara H.

description: Nice place use the groupon app decent prices even without it good doughnuts , loved the doughnut holes, and best of all the actually have a restroom so that is impressive, it's condition after the lunch rush isn't something I would guarantee though lol
author: Lamonee P.

description: I am a regular there for coffee, today decided to step it up and order a couple of donuts and a tuna sandwich. The staff is very cordial and mannerly,it just seemed that keeping track of the orders was a challenge. I ordered...paid,then a young lady looked at me as if I were loitering and asked me 'what would you like' mind you she had asked me that just minutes earlier. Then I had to remind them I paid, as i got no receipt,and the very cordial young man...o yeah you paid sorry. I get it was busy,but on the corner of Market street you have to know that's going to happen. But the prompt response of a veteran there in squaring things up,makes this a place you should try.
author: Jimmy L.

description: It looks like a donut shop from the outside yet they also have a full kitchen.   The guys working the counter are great, the food comes out fast and the quality/price is very reasonable. The resturant is located very close to the county welfare building, usually theres a crazy person or two performing outside the window.
author: P A.

description:
Staff is cordial, takes cc and cash, and open 24/7 which is huge. 

Tried a pork bun, which was microwaved and hard with questionable meat, definitely dont recommend. All the pastries looked average at best. 

The sandwiches though are solid, got the new Grilled Oriental Chicken, essentially a chicken banh mi. Little too much mayo, but bread was toasted perfectly and priced decently. Definitely recommend a hot sandwich if you find yourself here.
author: Joon B.

description: Work is not far from this place so I usually come here because it's convenient and its 24/7. I can't say much because the only thing on the menu I order is the Philly cheese steak, nothing else and this was recommended by a co-worker which was not as bad as I thought it would be. Be cautious late night, random crazies tend to hang around and cause a ruckus.
author: Rick M.

description: This is a quick and easy option for a bite while you're waiting for your Honda to be serviced across the street.  Lots of doughnuts, bagels, and breakfast sandwiches await!  This is great especially when the more upscale eateries in Hayes Valley aren't open yet on a Saturday morning.
author: Miran C.

description:
Great deal - $5.00 for an egg salad sandwich w/ a small bag of chips. The sandwich came out to be quite large. Smooth texture and fresh veggies.

They also have a large selection of donuts/pastries along w/ a menu of Asian food/lunch items.
author: Julie L.

description:
Awful awful awful!  I think the worst place to eat in SF. I have eaten at quite a few spots in the city and this is the first one that turned my stomach. 
I had a pastrami on rye and it was extremely greasy and tough and chewy. As I was trying to chew it I felt something stringy in my mouth. I pulled out what looked like string or plastic or something very stringy.  I only took two bites and pulled these strings out of both bites. That was it. Two bites and I couldn't eat another bite. I'm a big guy and I can eat almost anything and a lot of it and I couldn't put anymore of this, whatever it was, in my mouth.
author: Mark C.

description:
Love this place!

On Saturdays, I have a hella busy work schedule across the street at the SFCM, but on the rare occasion I can break away for a 5 min coffee break, this is my go to place.

They are super efficient, super cheap, super friendly, and have really strong coffee and fresh delicious donuts.

My only complaint is that the building is way over due for an update ...like plastic surgery grade makeover. 

But other than that, I wouldn't make it through my Saturdays with out this place!
author: Nicholas D.

description:
All star is a great place. Open all the time.
Great food. Takes credit cards too! And they accept orders ahead of time via Square. Awesome.
author: Wesley K.

description: Everyone is really friendly. They have huge cookies, donuts, and teriyaki plates for only $6! I like this place.
author: Ryan K.

description: I wouldn't bring a date here but you can definitely impress the boys with the best 24/7 place to eat in the SOMA, even though it's on the north side of Market street. The five stars is based solely on that its a great late night place to eat in SF.
author: Felix M.

description:
At the counter, she said they have American, Swiss, and Monterey Jack, so I ordered a breakfast sandwich with Monterey Jack, and I repeated the bit about the cheese so I was sure they understood.

Which was fine except that either she doesn't understand what Monterey Jack cheese is or she thought I wouldn't notice that it was just American "cheese" without the yellow food coloring.  

Crap sandwich; I want a do-over.

There's no excuse for not understanding the difference between American cheese and real cheese, even if you didn't grow up eating cheese.  

The coffee was fine.
author: Trevor S.

description:
I stopped by here with some friends after clubbing. We were starving and this was the only place open at the time that was within walking distance that we knew of. Mind you, it was close to 2am.

To be honest, I didn't expect much from the food there because it looked run down and had homeless people inside. The donut case and the smell of grilled onions won me over though, so I decided to get something anyway.

I ordered the chicken bacon sandwich with a maple cake donut with chocolate sprinkles while my friends got a tuna melt and a philly cheese steak with a sugar donut on the side respectively. 

The donut was good.....I saw a small fly on the bottom part of the case later though. It didn't land on anything but....ew.

The sandwiches were crappy. I couldn't finish mine. The chicken was dry and the little pieces were too crumbly for me. Not to mention the mayonnaise for days. This was not worth $6.

My friend was unhappy with her philly cheese steak too but my other friend seemed to enjoy hers completely. It DID look better than ours but probably because it was made with wheat bread slices rather than the cheap bread rolls they had. 

To add onto my pleasant experience, one of the homeless guys kept trying to get our attention which was creepy. The owners didn't really do anything to keep them out either. They seemed too tired to do anything about it. 

Maybe it's better in the mornings but overall....I would never go back.
author: Sofia R.

description: VALUE and satisfaction. Coffee needs to be better but for unpretentious anti gentrificationism, 5 Starz.
author: Mag N.

description:
Flies in the donut case. I told them but they didn't care. What other unsanitary things going on in the back.
Grade:F
author: Gerald H.

description: I love their philly cheese stake sandwich and mushroom  cheese stake! It's very delicious, more important it's fresh! So are the donuts! The price is very good. Friendly customer services and fast. If you want tasty sandwiches for your work break or something grab n go, this is the place. The place is easy to locate, right on Market St. cross Van Ness. The staff are very polite, thanks for making the world beautiful again!! I hope more business run the way you do. Will recommend everyone I know. May your business continue to prosper! : )
author: Noah W.

description: Free coffee for posting 5 star review....coffee was burnt. I liked the bagel and lox though.
author: Dana R.

description:
This place has ended up being so convenient for me, because I currently live on Market St. and would walk to the Conservatory of Music every day.

At first, I was skeptical, because it seemed a bit dirty, but the food is pretty decent. I've ordered both Chicken and Vegetable Teriyaki plates. The vegetables aren't super cooked, but it is a big portion. 

Also, the pastries are a good price. I got a big cinnamon bun for $2 and doughnuts go for $1.
author: Emily D.

description:
If you enjoy eating in a cafe where all the customers have just walked thru lots of pigeon shit, human excrement and vomit this is the place for you! Why the health dept does not do something about this is beyond me. I have lived near by here for 30 years 
and it is always filthy even after asking them to clean it and reporting them on the 311 APP. Would would NEVER EAT HERE again.
author: K. K.

description:
The donuts. Are. Fantastic. The sandwiches are cheap and surprisingly good. Yes, they have homeless people in there sometimes. They do their best to kick the really smelly/loud ones out- it's on Van Ness, what do you expect??

Overall, an island of decent food and LOW prices in a sea of overpriced touristy food. THE DONUTS ARE SO GOOD.
author: Glynnis O.

description: They have great sandwiches.  I particularly like their egg salad sandwich on toasted whole wheat with everything.  Staff is always rushed but they do a good job.  I enjoy speaking Mandarin with the staff.
author: Richard F.

description: The grilled turkey and cheese sandwich is hands-down one of the best sandwiches in SF. Seriously it is SO GOOD. You'd never expect it from a place like this, but my mouth is watering just thinking about it. Plus it comes with a bag of chips for like $6. Mmmmm....
author: Casey N.

description: I love the donuts and coffee. Hard to find a spot like this. Its a place you can just chill and watch the world fly by. Service is really good and speedy. Friendly and beautiful Chinese ladies, and they have a variety of food. The doughnuts are on point and so is the coffee. I highly recommend this for you.
author: Chris E.

description:
I'm glad I skipped a $10 wrap at another place to come here on a Saturday morning. I got a bacon egg and cheese sandwich which was delicious and cooked with love. While waiting I couldn't resist eyeing all the donuts, so I bought a glazed...

Best glazed donut I've had in years!! It was so fluffy and fresh and flakey that I barely had to chew it-- it practically melts in your saliva as your taste buds realize you found a bite of heaven.
author: Jay P.

description: Everyone is so friendly and nice, so great customer service.  Food is also great.  Their donuts and hot foods are both amazing.  I can eat their philly cheese steaks everyday, it is absolutely amazing! You have to try this shop when you're in San Francisco.  I go back almost every week.  They have absolutely everything there!
author: Henrianna C.

description:
I pass by this place a lot on my way to the Planning Dep. I didnt have time for breakfast today so i stopped by for a coffee and pastry. I got the pastry that looks like a glazed bear-claw but it was actually filled with apple filling. Its ok though because i like both. The pastry was delicious. The dough just melts in your mouth because it was so fresh and although i felt so guilty because of how sugary and fattening it was i dont regret finishing it because the trip to the gym tonight will be worth the indulgence. A little hard to eat when you're on the run because there was so much filling in it it was oozing out of the pastry with every bite. They have a nice selection of coffee. I had hazelnut with cream and sugar. Nothing special about the coffee itself but the fact that they had so many options was nice. 

I would have gave it 5 stars if it wasn't "cash only". The ATM in the cafe charges you $3 per transaction, so although the breakfast cost me a mere $3.50, altogether it cost me $6.50. Which is still not bad because the pastry was so large for its price.
author: Lena E.

description: This place can't help that they are in a weird part of town. Their donuts are fresh and food is good! I like their chicken teriyaki (it's cheap!) and their tuna melts! The staff is attentive and quick. Also, the pork buns... are only $2. Get one!
author: Kristina B.

description:
Well....I'm not too sure if this qualifies as a review, per se. But I walk by this small establishment at least twice a day whilst en route to the MUNI, so here goes. 

I don't know that I could ever bring myself to eat from here...ever. Whenever I walk by, there's always a foul smell coming out from the doors. Also, there's a number of homeless inside and out, begging for change/food/clipper fares.

I don't think it's the workers fault...they seem nice enough. But there's always sad looking homeless people sitting in the windows.

My boyfriend tried their coffee once and said it was horrendous.
author: Ashley P.

description: This stretch of Market really attracts the riffraff.. Anyway, it's 4a and I can have a BLT with egg, but not bacon, egg, and cheese on a croissant. It's the same amount of effort, I don't understand.
author: J K.

description: Great service, they have so delicious sandwiches, delicious donuts, and much more... I recommend this place and they are open 24 hrs!!
author: Jose I.

description: NOT 24 hours. I've walked here three times in the sketchiest of areas and people, especially outside, only to find a note that says "open 5:30am". No sign of when they close, and I've been here at 2am, 11:30pm, and finally 9pm. Not cool.
author: Cassidy B.

description:
I really feel for the people who work here.  Van Ness and Market seems to be the epicenter of crazy at 8am when I'm usually passing through.  The clerk is always getting harassed by some mentally-unstable creeper picking his nose and trying to bum a cup of coffee and a donut, but she's always smiling

My guilty pleasure is stopping at this place during my morning commute and getting a Maple glazed donut to munch on with my coffee.  (nom)^3.

I have literally ran into this place, filled up a cup of coffee and creme, tossed $2 at the register and ran out to catch a bus, and the woman smiled the whole time.  

Coffee isn't amazing but it's fast and extremely convenient.
author: Mike C.

description: Delicious pastries and sandwiches. Looks questionable from the outside, but give it a try!
author: Lari S.

description: Not sure if there's been an ownership change, but service is not quite what it used ot be..so deducted one star.
author: Karen H.

description: The coffee is nothing to speak of... But the apple fritter was DELISH & enough for two to share.
author: Marsha G.

description: Good place to get food to go. I work nearby and all my co workers love this place! I highly recommend this cafe!
author: Ayra L.

description: I kid you not: their philly steak sandwich with jalapeños is the best you can find!  Yummy! :-)
author: Sameer C.

description:
This place is certainly not gourmet, but look at it and look at the prices. It should be gross.  It is not gross, however, and the avocado sandwich is in fact delicious. It is the perfect way for a poor music student to to stay fed and to eat her vegetables. I have had one almost every day I have been in this city.

The baked goods are also tasty.

Five stars from me for exceeding expectations tremendously and for filling me up without emptying my bank account.
author: Amanda S.

description:
These donuts are so gooddd.  Maple cruller and maple old fashioned, yum!  Way better than Bob's, in my opinion, whose only claim to fame is the apple fritter.  I don't like apple fritters.

Really good breakfast sandwiches too; they fry you a real egg on the spot.  

Cash only!
author: Erika C.

description: Let me cut my story short, it's great efficient and the flavors combine....But there's downfalls as well so a 3.
author: Alex R.

description: I had their egg salad sandwich, and it came out big and delicious! It had onions, lettuce and tomatoes! Along with a small little surprise of a bag of lays chips. All for 5$. I would come here for the egg salad sandwich again :)
author: J M.

description: Ended up at this place with a few friends, got chicken wings. The sauce was amazing. I wouldn't normally expect wings or sauce to be particularly exceptional at a place identifying as a cafe, but I suppose this was a supernormal situation. On top of that, the service was great as well. We were helped by a guy named Darren, it was top notch. Would definitely recommend.
author: Osagie E.

description:
This place sucks! The owners are cheap and rude. 

Me and my friend came in to get some water as a complimentary cup because we were very thirsty and he would not give us any.. Pathetic
author: Lauren N.

description: I work down the street from this place.. I will say their coffee is a little pricy. But their mushroom philly cheese steaks are DELICIOUS it comes with a bag of lays! & Also their Chicken Teriyaki is bombb!!
author: Yeni K.

description: I used to go to this place once in a blue moon for a quick cup of coffee from a plastic dispenser or a plastic-wrapped muffin, only because it is the only place for food right at the intersection other than Walgreens. There is a slightly better food selection midblock in any direction, but if you're waiting for the bus or have business in the long blocks of Upper Market, you'll take whatever you can get at the intersection. Another plus is that it is open late. I wouldn't come here if I wasn't desperate though. It's cash only also.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This place takes up a corner of this block and is very convenient for me since I work so close by. It's a really small place, but offers many items on their menu, ranging from pastries, donuts, BBQ pork buns to sandwiches and salads. They have excellent coffee; I was really surprised that this hole in the wall had such a large variety of coffee and was actually really good! They also have fresh fruit and hardboiled egg as breakfast items. 

 The cashier woman is always really friendly....or so it seems. A couple of times I have been there, I've seen her kindly say "have a great day!" and then turn around to the other ladies and talk some serious smack in Chinese about the hobo outside. It was really shocking to see such a sweet woman talk so much shit! lol I guess thats just how Chinese ppl roll though. ( I should know, I've seen my mother do it countless times hahha)

I've had their chocolate chip scone which isn't that great. Their bran muffin is really good though! Gotta be careful.... I've seen a few flies sneak into their display case eek!

CASH ONLY
author: Mindy H.

description: They are offering free coffee in exchange if 5 stars yelp review. Not too happy about that...
author: Jorge G.

description: Was staying on Market on a quick trip to San Francisco and discovered this place as I was walking down the street. Awesome discovery!  Very delicious bacon/ham, egg, cheese, and avocado sandwiches on sourdough. It became my go-to in the morning.Also, there is good selection of different kinds of coffees to select from (French Vanilla, Colombian, Hazelnut)... The price was just right and i would recommend this place to anyone. Sure, there are some homeless folks on the other side of it outside but that is par for the course in SF and any major city. Nice place to have a great breakfast and people-watch from the big glass windows as people cross over Van Ness and Market. Loved this place. Will totally go back the next time I am in SF.
author: Erica J.

description:
It's 2:30 in the AM downtown in SF (Tenderloin district to be exact), and what's there to do if you are in want of some grub?

Walk the streets of course!

Yeah, in most cases, this is a bad idea, but it worked out for us because we received some star treatment at the All Star.

This joint is opened all night.  They have gaggles of donuts, but that's not all.  They cold got noodles, and can make all kinds of sandwiches.  Aw yeah!

I went with a fried egg sandwich with cheese on sourdough, and a Cactus Cooler....um, and a maple donut.  

Open all night---definitely 4-star worthy.
author: Corey G.

description: Just miserable and not a place to go but always open so I end up here ever so often.
author: Justin S.

description: Can come in and get a coffee and egg sandwich for under $7. It's not going to be artisan cheese and single source coffee, but there's something beautiful about a fresh egg, cheese, and bacon on an English muffin. Great place for a quick, inexpensive breakfast.
author: Mark W.

description: This awkward architecture that is All Star at the corner of Van Ness and Market is a place where you would go if you forgot or were to busy to eat breakfast at home. I'm not a coffee person so I won't review from that angle. I don't think you can mess up donuts but the breakfast sandwiches are a bit overpriced for their contents. Just putting it out there.  Eat at home if you can
author: Destiny P.

description: It looks like the most unsanitary place on earth. The bums literally hang outside of the ATM machine asking for money. They make a mean breakfast sando - but you have to realllly want it.
author: Karen G.

description:
This place gets 4 stars from me for one reason and one reason only. Exceptional service during the early hours of the morning. I was stranded on market around 2am, waiting for my friend to come pick me up since for once there were no taxis to be found. It was raining and freezing. And if you know that area you know that hookers like to hang out in front of the Bank Of America across the street. 

All Star Cafe was the only thing open in my vicinity. I went in and sat down at one of their tables near the windows. It was awesomely warm inside and had the delcious smell of fresh donuts. I felt really bad cuz I didn't have any money on me to at least give the guy behind the counter some business, which I sadly told him. He seemed to sense that I wasn't where I wanted to be at that particular moment. So he came back a few mins later with a fresh donut and a cup of chamomile tea. For FREE. Said that I looked like I needed to catch a break. Probably the nicest thing that a stranger has done for me in the city.4 stars for humanity.
author: Christine L.

description: Open 24 hours.  Fresh donuts available at 7am.  I just went and got three different kinds, my favorite was the maple french.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
So, I'm going to give this place a solid A-OK.  I have to admit that this isn't the kind of place I'd probably go on my own, but I was with a gaggle of other people and they suggested we go here for a quick bite/beverage before we had to do something else.  

First of all, it's in a pretty convenient location for the area and it's a standalone building.  The area right outside is kinda shady though.  It might be because there's some tall buildings that block the sun....

So, they have a variety of different kinds of food, but since it was still morning on a Saturday, A and I decided to split a big cinnamon roll and a cup of hot chocolate.  The prices were very reasonable, but it is cash only - which may be why there was a man in there constantly asking us for a nickel.  I mean, why would we be there if we didn't have any cash on us, right?  It was a bit harassing though because he wouldn't leave us alone and he really wanted that nickel.  The lady behind the counter finally told him to leave and not harass the customers.

Anyway, we sat down at one of the tables to eat (the cinnamon roll and the hot chocolate were actually quite good, by the way) and the guy comes back in and apologizes....because he really meant to ask for a quarter, not a nickel.
author: Kris L.

description: Sandwiches were delicious, donuts were super yummy and fresh, and the 24/7 hours are prefect for late night snacks!!
author: Sean S.

description:
I have to say it: I just don't get the people who want a Dunkin Donuts or a Krispy Kreme in San Francisco.  When I lived in NYC, I used to come to SF for vacations and be soooo excited about getting fresh and different doughnuts in San Francisco rather than the stale limp thing that passes as doughnuts at Dunkin Donuts and Krispy Kreme (I am sure they just inject fat into Krispy Kreme doughnuts and that's why everybody likes them...I really do not enjoy Krispy Kreme doughnuts whatsoever, and that's saying a lot from a gal who enjoys almost any fatty food product concocted on this planet).  Everytime I was visiting SF, I would buy two doughnuts from All Star for the plane ride back. 

Plus, now that i have learned from the information-minded Yelpers that this All Star is open 24 hours...that just made my day.  One of these days, I really want to do the midnight run for doughnuts that I keep on hearing about.  Ya know: show up in the middle of the night and smell the just-fried doughnuts thing.

They also sell cheap sandwiches.  The person who introduced me to the sandwiches raved about their Philly steak sandwiches.  After I had All Star's Philly steak sandwich, I was convinced my friend had never had a genuine Philly steak sandwich in his whole life.  But it's still a cheap sandwich that's decent, just not a Philly steak sandwich.

Moreover, when I walk to work on weekends (because I have to procrastinate as long as possible to get to work on a weekend...as well as try to get some retail therapy on Market St. to convince myself to step a foot into the office on a weekend day) I stop by and get one of those long doughnuts with custard in the middle.  By the way, last time I was at Dunkin Donuts and Krispy Kreme, they didn't have those long doughnuts which lets you fool yourself into believing you are having the same fatty content as just a regular smaller doughnut.

I like the Marina All Star doughnuts better...but this one is closer and not in the Marina, and open 24 hours.  

San Franciscans: wake up and smell the doughnut...this is better than Krispy Kreme or Dunkin Donuts.
author: Sooj O.

description:
This is the place to get coffee and breakfast.  Super easy, super fast, super cheap.  I love the word super apparently--sounds like supper, and I like to eat....

Anyways,  
Its great cause its open all the time, they serve dough nut holes--which tide me over before going to bed with a gut full of booze.  Dough nut holes--they are like preventative hangover pills. 

I go here in my PJs--not an issue at all.  If they serve the homeless they can serve me in my undies.
author: Bill B.

description:
I gotta step up for the All Star Cafe.
I found it while doing some work for the SF Opera, and ran in to see what they could offer.  I also was interested because it's just around the corner from the Conservatory of Music.

Here's the good of it:
Simple, cheap, yet full menu, offering some healthy variety (fresh fruit box, fresh veggies on the sandwiches).  The food is made to order, the breads are fresh (they have whole wheat), and the kitchen seems pretty clean.  The staff working there are  extremely friendly and quick, especially given the riff-raff they sometimes have to put up with.

The Thai iced-tea and the Chai is some of the best I've had throughout the City so far.  The coffee is not bad.. it's relatively fresh and cheap.

Also, it's open 24 hours and is not a bad operation for being open  and accessible all the time.
Here's the challenge:
The location.  Yes, there may be some peddlers and crazies about the outside, they do stay out and not in. It lacks the charm of other places and the seating is limited, but the place is not deisgned for hanging out.. it's a short-order cafe.  Also, they only take cash (but there is a BOA and other ATMs at the same intersection).

The final word...  Great place for decent food all hours of the day.  Grab a quick bite, say hi to the great guys and ladies working there, be on your way, having saved a buck or two.

(this was edited after frequenting the All Star for a year after I first wrote this review)
author: Nathan M.

description: Good pastries, bad lattes. It's not often I get a drink bad enough I want to throw it out. Latte was far too hot and very bitter. On the plus side, it was hot enough to be a self defense drink for the next twenty minutes..
author: George H.

description:
Given it's location, and the fact that it's open really late, you can imagine that All Star Cafe gets more than its fair share of characters coming through. As such, you would expect the staff to be pretty defensive and suspicious of their customers, however, my experience has always been the opposite. I've been to this cafe dozens of times, and the staff have always been friendly. 

All Star Cafe is a very straight forward pastry / coffee shop, no frills, but the food is actually not bad. I'm not a coffee drinker, so I can't comment on the quality of the coffee. 

The Cafe has a very limited amount of seating indoors which, during the day, is often occupied by nearby workers. Not that you would want to sit here. As a no frills cafe, ambiance and people watching are not enjoyable activities at this location (though, it is interesting if you happen to be either a cop or a shrink).
author: Frank B.

description:
Not bad at all.  Came here on a chilly Sunday night and got a grilled cheese sandwich and a cup of hot chocolate.  It definitely hit the spot.  I forget how much it was, but it must have been around $7.00?  Not too sure.
My vegan friend ordered the veggie teriyaki, and even though she said it was the grossest thing she'd ever eaten, she did eat the whole thing so it couldn't have been that bad.
I'd definitely go back here again to have a wide choice of options when not much else is open.
Also, you can watch street people from the windows.  Sometimes they come in and stare at you while you're trying to eat, but it's more comical than scary.
author: Meh M.

description:
Not bad All Star. I used to pass by this place almost everyday on my way home from school and would often pop in for a drink. I especially liked this place because they sold my flavor of vitamn water. 

Not a huge fan of the donuts, the few times that I bought them here they were very stale and tasted too much like lemon when they should not have. Given that, they always did fill the sugar void I was seeking to fill, and never made me feel sick!

Oh, and they do not make change for muni, don't even bother asking, just by something and hope you get the right amounts of quarters / dollar bills.
author: Allyson S.

description:
All-Star donuts will melt in your mouth.  The warm ooozy fat from your glazed donut will then proceed to attach itself to your bulging love handles. 

If you can't resist, utilize the homeless mobs that pester the morning crowds by offering up a dollar to go in and buy you one of these little golden treats.  Otherwise everyone in the office will know your off that "amazing diet" you've been talking up all week, by the irrestistable smell of frylater that is free with every visit!
author: Stanley E.

description: I have been here a few times. It's ok. Nothing fancy nothing great, nothing horrible. In the morning there is a flood of commuters getting a hot coffee (sometimes too hot to even taste) and maybe a pastry of some sort. The coffee is sort of not good, but the croissants are ok. If it wasn't there the few faithful mornings where I got stopped by the light to cross the street, I probably wouldn't come back. But that light does get me :(
author: Greg G.

description: Very friendly service. Food was alright, just average. Mocha turned out okay as well. Good location, near Muni station, Bank of America and Walgreens. Will come back to try their brewed coffee & other food items. A bit pricey, but I guess food prices here reflect the location. Oh yes, cash only.
author: Allyson L.

description:
cash only
ripped blue seats
homeless people begging for change
the thai ice tea is yummy
author: annie y.

description: Good coffee. I like the chicken noodle salad. The sanwiches all come with chips. The staff is really freindly. I always get a warm smile when I stumble in to grab my coffee before heading to work. The prices are inline with other places in the area.
author: Brian D.

description:
Yes it's a donut and coffee shop, and I got neither of the two. I got a pretty good grilled turkey and cheese sandwich with avocado on a sweet roll. It came with the teeny bag of Lays plain potato chips and put me back just under $8. It was tasty and all, but I find that to be a bit overpriced for nothing fancy.

It was the only place around open on a Saturday afternoon, however, so that's definitely a plus.
author: Jennie H.

description:
Hands down, best BLT you will ever get...yum yum yum. 

ps: their donuts are insanely good as well.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I've never eaten anything here but I walk by every day on my walk to the Van Ness MUNI.

The smell eminating out of this spot is absoutely vile.

Thanks for ruining my morning All Stars.
author: Ben S.

description: It took a full year, but things may be looking up.  No more donut holes dropped on the counter and a clear attempt at better staffing means that I will be returning after all.
author: Lee S.

description: News flash, prissy bitches: this is a DONUT SHOP.
author: Maria D.

description: Have had a great BLT here at various hours of the day, including before taking in a performance at the ballet .  On Valentine's Day.  By myself.  Yeah - that's how I roll.  Go on ahead to your quirkyalone meet and greet and leave me to my bacon.
author: L W.

description: I walk by this cafe on the way to work everyday. Used to coffee from them all the time, but since I cut down on caffeine, I stopped going in.  However, their service is pretty friendly and efficient. Decent place for being in the area that they are in.
author: Jason H.

description: Extremely convenient location, with tasty, cheap, well-executed donuts
author: Mark A.

description: I actually wanted to get a banh mi across the street at Boston Cafe, but they're closed on Sunday so I came here. They list below "Cheesesteak" a "Mushroom cheesesteak". I inquired if this was a cheesesteak that used mushrooms instead of beef as a vegetarian option but was told, no, it's beef plus mushrooms and peppers and onions. I asked if I could substitute the beef for more mushrooms and onions and peppers. The guy thought about it for a while and nodded ok. He grilled up a fresh, hot mushroom cheesesteak for me. It wasn't the most amazing cheesesteak I've ever had, but it was pretty good, it was fresh, plentiful, and big ups to the guy for accommodating me.
author: Rennie L.

description:
Oh all star cafe why not its 24 hours and on my way to the M stop
Cash only 
24 hours
Fast service and orders 
Homeless men always asking to buy you a cup of coffee 
Also about 2.50 will get u a small coffee and an old fashion which are amazing ! 
For a morning you don't feel like spending at blue bottle or if ur up

 between the hours of 12 and 5 am 
Let me not forget to add the random noodle dishes and sandwiches have never tried them but they don't look too bad
author: hayes v.

description: If you all remember from previous posts, im a gutterpunk junky for caffeine. Not shit caffeine like in Coke or Mountain Dew, but the real shit, in coffee. So, there are times of weakness, when any semblance of coffee will do. Enter the All Star Cafe. Off the bat, the name of the place. Unless the homeless are being voted in for a mid season game, i fail to see the All Stars here. It did however, conjur up a pretty funny idea that i had which is if you were to... CENSORED CENSORED CENSORED ...fferent districts...hahahah. Phew! Good thing that was censored!...Anyway...coffee terrible, donuts terrible, ambiance..umm.... Not quite a first date type of place, but the best last date type of place imaginable.
author: Mick F.

description: You know, I actually had a pretty good tuna melt here... granted, I was supremely hung over and the homeless people hadn't taken up their posts on the corner just yet.  So I guess what I'm saying is... tequila shots anyone?
author: Grave Y.

description: Always cheap, always open & ready, and almost always very tasty (get some Thai Ice Tea and some noodles; yummy yummy). Many a good meal was bought here on breaks from rehearsing at NCTC, and any time I'm in that area of the city and feeling a bit peckish, I try to stop by All Star for a bit to eat.
author: Casey B.

description:
it seems like the map isn't showing this in the right place??

i got a HUGE cinnamon roll that was delicious! I also got a sandwich that was just okay. not very memorable.  i didn't rush right home after eating to yelp about it because it was like meh, no big deal.  

it is convenient though, i'll give them that.
author: Levi B.

description:
I have purchased the occasional can of soda when picking up take out with friends (I have never eaten a meal here)
The real reason I want to write about this place is the fried egg sandwich that my husband ate here.
We were killing some time before going to a recital across the street
I got a soda and a maple donut
the donut was fair, and the can of soda was- uh- a can of soda
 The default toppings on the fried egg sandwich 
are mayonnaise, pickle, lettuce, onion, and mustard
we didn't realize this when he ordered, and it was a bit shocking when he unwrapped it to eat
this is like the funniest thing i have ever heard...
he went up to ask for some ketchup
and the counter guy was like- 
"ketchup- really? are you sure?" 
he thought it was weird to put ketchup on a fried egg sandwich.
the sandwich was not good from any angle
EXCEPT for the fact that it makes me laugh to think about someone considering it way more normal or common place to put mayo, pickle, tomato and lettuce on a fried egg sandwich than ketchup.
author: Maxine M.

description:
After spending some of my afternoon at the wonderful SFMTA, I found myself to be rather hungry and seeing as how I had no food at home, I was wondering what I should eat.  When I saw the sign for the All-Star Cafe, my mouth started to water as I thought back to an awesome meatball sandwich I had back in Vegas.  

I go in hoping I would be able to relive that taste but unfortunately they didn't have a meatball sandwich on the menu.  Instead I opted to get a philly cheesesteak.  The best thing about the sandwich was the fact that even after not being able to get back home for another 20-25 minutes to eat it, it was still toasty and delicious.  I was getting a little full halfway through the sandwich but found myself eating the whole thing.  If I ever feel like going to that part of town again, I think I'm gonna get me another sandwich.
author: Joel J.

description: This donut shop has a secret: Their philly cheesesteaks are THE BOMB (especially after a long night of clubbing). I'll have to knock a star off though...I was behind 3 other people waiting for phillys as well and the idiot on the grill made everyones order one at a time (I know it's not a big grill but you can at least do 2 at a time). I thought i was gonna miss my bus home and muni isn't exactly reliable at 2 AM in the morning.
author: Mike A.

description: With the friendly service and delicious donuts/pastries, their prices seem just about right. Mmm...donuts.
author: Katie N.
